com.noctarius.tengi.core.serialization

Interface Marshallable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    HandshakeRequest, HandshakeResponse, LongPollingRequest, LongPollingResponse, Packet

    public interface Marshallable

    The Marshallable interface defines a common type for objects that have knowledge about how to be serialized or de-serialized. This mechanism can be used for high performance and low latency serialization since this special system is optimized internally.

    Another option is to implement external serialization using the Marshaller interface which supports external serialization to implement immutable types or integrate other serialization frameworks.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void marshall(Encoder encoder, Protocol protocol)
      This method implements logic to marshall (serialize) this object into a stream of bytes using the given Encoder.
      void unmarshall(Decoder decoder, Protocol protocol)
      This method implements logic to un-marshall (de-serialize) this object from a stream of bytes using the given Decoder.

    • Method Detail

      • marshall

        void marshall(Encoder encoder,
              Protocol protocol)
       throws Exception
        This method implements logic to marshall (serialize) this object into a stream of bytes using the given Encoder. The given Protocol instance might be used to build complex stream graphs.
        Parameters:
        encoder - Encoder to write to
        protocol - Protocol instance for additional protocol complexity
        Throws:
        Exception

      • unmarshall

        void unmarshall(Decoder decoder,
                Protocol protocol)
         throws Exception
        This method implements logic to un-marshall (de-serialize) this object from a stream of bytes using the given Decoder. The given Protocol instance might be used to handle complex stream graphs.
        Parameters:
        decoder - Decoder to read from
        protocol - Protocol instance for additional protocol complexity
        Throws:
        Exception
